title: Little Berkhamsted Walks

images.title: Talisman / Little Berkhamsted Village Green
images.caption: Looking across The Village Green and cricket ground from the Hertfordshire Way - Bridleway from Epping Green to Little Berkhamsted Lane. On the left are new houses along "The Boundary", the village shop, the Coach and Horses Pub in the middle (to the right of the large tree) and the Village Hall & houses on the right.

images.caption: Field at Epping Green

description: This Hertfordshire based village lies just to the south west of Hertford. The attractive village is known for the Grade II listed Stratton's Tower, an excellently preserved five-storey observatory dating to 1789. There's also Little Berkhamsted House an 18th century house notable for its stately Greek Dorich porch. This circular walk from the village uses part of the Hertfordshire Chain Walk to explore the villages, countryside and woodland surrounding Little Berkhamsted. The route starts in the village and heads east to the neighbouring village of Bayford. You then head south passing Gidner's Wood and Blackfan Wood. Just before Newgate Street you turn west to head past Ponsbourne Park Hotel towards Epping Green. From here you continue north to return to Little Berkhamsted.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Back in the village you can enjoy some post exercise rest and refreshment at the Five Horseshoes. The Grade II listed pub serves a fine Sunday lunch and has a pleasant garden area to relax in. They are located on Church Road at postcode SG13 8LY for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The country and woodland trails are ideal for dog walking. The Five Horseshoes mentioned above is also dog friendly.

display_address: Church Road, Little Berkhamsted, East Hertfordshire, Hertfordshire, England, SG13 8LZ, United Kingdom
